channel.title: Military Space on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Military Space on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: China’s Guowang megaconstellation is more than another version of Starlink
item.description: “This is a strategy to keep the US from intervening… that’s what their space architecture is designed to do.”

item.title: After first operational launch, here’s the next big test for ULA’s Vulcan rocket
item.description: This launch was a big success, but it doesn’t necessarily quash anxieties about ULA’s ability to deliver.

item.title: Space Force officials take secrecy to new heights ahead of key rocket launch
item.description: This will be the first national security mission to fly on United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket.

item.title: The military’s squad of satellite trackers is now routinely going on alert
item.description: “I hope this blows your mind because it blows my mind.”

item.title: Ars spoke with the military’s chief orbital traffic cop—here’s what we learned
item.description: “We have some 2,000 or 2,200 objects that I call the ‘red order of battle.’”

item.title: What exactly is Golden Dome? This Space Force general owes Trump an answer.
item.description: “Basically, I’ve been given 60 days to come up with the objective architecture.”

item.title: It’s hunting season in orbit as Russia’s killer satellites mystify skywatchers
item.description: “Once more, we play our dangerous game—a game of chess—against our old adversary.”

item.title: Nearly everyone opposes Trump’s plan to kill space traffic control program
item.description: Space Force officials and more than 450 aerospace companies are against the White House’s proposal.
